vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/bd9154ff-df07-4704-b4df-6c2a07fbff25">URBAN AREAS</keyword>         <topcClas>Teaching packages and test datasets - Reference and instructional resources</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <i>English Housing Survey 2008-2009 Household Data Teaching Dataset</i> is based on the <i>English Housing Survey, 2008-2009: Household Data</i> (available from the UK Data Archive under SN 6613) and constitutes real data which are used by the Department for Communities and Local Government and are behind many headlines. The teaching dataset is a subset which has been subjected to certain simplifications and additions for the purpose of learning and teaching.<br>  <br> The main differences are:<ul><li>the number of variables has been reduced</i><li>weighting has been simplified</i><li>a reduced codebook is provided</i></ul>Further information is available in the study documentation (below) which includes a dataset user.<br> <br> Information about other teaching resources can be found on the <a href="http://www.esds.ac.uk/resources/learning.asp" title="Teaching and learning">teaching and learning</a> web pages.<br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>The main topics covered are:<ul><li>housing characteristics</li><li>household characteristics</li><li>satisfaction with the home and local area</li></ul></abstract>       <sumDscr>         <collDate event="start" date="2008-04-01T00:00:00Z">April 2008</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="2009-03-01T00:00:00Z">March 2009</collDate>         <nation>England</nation>         <geogUnit>Government Office Regions</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <anlyUnit> Families/households</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Dwellings and their occupants in England, 2008-2009.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Cross-sectional (one-time) study</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>The EHS is an annual cross-sectional study, but this teaching dataset has been compiled using only data from the 2008-2009 household survey.</timeMeth>         <sampProc>Multi-stage stratified random sample</sampProc>         <deviat>17,691 households</deviat>         <collMode>Face-to-face interview; Compilation or synthesis of existing material</collMode>         <collMode>The EHS is collected by a face-to-face interview but the teaching dataset has been created by simplifying and altering the original data.</collMode>         <sources>           <dataSrc>The data are taken from <i>English Housing Survey, 2008-2009: Household Data</i> which is available from the UK Data Archive under SN 6613.</dataSrc>         </sources>         <weight>Weighting used. See documentation for details</weight>         <cleanOps>A*</cleanOps>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Available to all registered users for any use</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is required. Available to all registered users. The depositor may be informed about usage.</restrctn>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Description: English</othRefs>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Documentation: English</othRefs>     </othrStdyMat>   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
